intro: Brachystele affinis, commonly known as the small-stemmed moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Hypnaceae. It is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth form and dark green, wiry leaves that are often curved. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Brachystele affinis has a short, compact stem and produces small, capsule-like sporophytes. It is an important component of microhabitats in tropical and subtropical regions.
